abstracts.cdata!:
The Taegu Urban Transport Project for
            the Republic of Korea achieved an overall satisfactory
            outcome. Despite some postponements, the project made a
            substantial contribution toward institutional development
            and led to an increase in traffic efficiency, capacity, and
            safety. The project applied transportation system management
            techniques and constructed the Shinchon Expressway and
            associated links. It also strengthened the Taegu City
            Government's transportation planning and traffic
            management capacity. Implementation of the project was
            satisfactory. Delays occurred due to land acquisition
            issues, but the project loan was fully disbursed and closed
            as scheduled. Sustainability of project benefits is likely,
            as there is every indication that the transportation system
            management techniques have been adopted and will continue to
            gain force in Taegu. One possible threat to sustainability
            is that traffic volumes continue to increase faster than
            forecasts, but the planned development of a subway system
            should mitigate this risk. Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Bank staff contributed to project success
            by recognizing the Government as a mature and capable
            institution. Borrower performance was satisfactory, as the
            Government successfully adapted to a challenging period of
            unanticipated rapid economic growth and sudden increase in
            land prices. The main lesson learned regards severely
            underestimating the cost and time of relocating local
            families affected by the construction. The Bank must ensure
            that the cost and scheduling of land acquisition are
            carefully estimated at appraisal when projects include land
            acquisition as a controlling element of implementation.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Taegu Urban Transport Project
            supports the Taegu City Government's (TCG) efforts to
            improve the transportation system within Taegu City through
            the construction of a major urban expressway and associated
            road investments, introduction and application of Traffic
            System Management (TSM) techniques, and strengthening of
            TCG's transportation planning capacity.  To that end,
            the project includes: (a) land acquisition and construction
            of the Shinchon Expressway, connecting roads, and associated
            bridge widenings.  The project furthermore entails (b) civil
            works for intersection improvements, pedestrian facilities,
            and other TSM and safety improvements, and the provision of
            traffic signals and other equipment; as well as (c) advisory
            services for transportation planning and construction
            supervision.  The main benefits of the project would be
            reduced congestion and improved traffic flows within Taegu
            City, especially in and around the Central Business District.
